It is the first such centre to be established in Sri Lanka.The MOU to establish the first Relief Service Centre in Anuradhapura for kidney patients of North Central Province was signed yesterday (28th Aug.) at the Health Ministry under the patronage of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratna. The Shanthi Foundation of Australia will donate Rs. 120 million to build and maintain the centre.In addition, they will provide funds for the upkeep of the centre for the next 100 years. It is the first such centre to be established in Sri Lanka.
title: Relief Service Centre for kidney patients
